verses.verse: Go to<WG33> now,<WG3568> ye rich men,<WG4145> weep<WG2799> and howl<WG3649> for<WG1909> your<WG5216> miseries<WG5004> that shall come upon<WG1904> you.
Your <WG5216> riches<WG4149> are corrupted,<WG4595> and<WG2532> your<WG5216> garments<WG2440> are<WG1096> motheaten.<WG4598>

Your <WG5216> gold<WG5557> and<WG2532> silver<WG696> is cankered;<WG2728> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> rust<WG2447> of them<WG846> shall be<WG2071> a<WG1519> witness<WG3142> against you,<WG5213> and<WG2532> shall eat<WG5315> your<WG5216> flesh<WG4561> as it were<WG5613> fire.<WG4442> Ye have heaped treasure together<WG2343> for<WG1722> the last<WG2078> days.<WG2250>

Behold, <WG2400> the<WG3588> hire<WG3408> of the<WG3588> laborers<WG2040> who have reaped down<WG270> your<WG5216> fields,<WG5561> which is of<WG575> you<WG5216> kept back by fraud,<WG650> crieth:<WG2896> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> cries<WG994> of them which have reaped<WG2325> are entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the<WG3588> ears<WG3775> of the Lord<WG2962> of Sabaoth.<WG4519>

Ye have lived in pleasure<WG5171> on<WG1909> the<WG3588> earth,<WG1093> and<WG2532> been wanton;<WG4684> ye have nourished<WG5142> your<WG5216> hearts,<WG2588> as in<WG1722> a day<WG2250> of slaughter.<WG4967>
Ye have condemned<WG2613> and killed<WG5407> the<WG3588> just;<WG1342> and he doth not<WG3756> resist<WG498> you.<WG5213>

Be patient<WG3114> therefore,<WG3767> brethren,<WG80> unto<WG2193> the<WG3588> coming<WG3952> of the<WG3588> Lord.<WG2962> Behold,<WG2400> the<WG3588> husbandman<WG1092> waiteth for<WG1551> the<WG3588> precious<WG5093> fruit<WG2590> of the<WG3588> earth,<WG1093> and<WG2532> hath long patience<WG3114> for<WG1909> it,<WG846> until<WG2193> <WG302> he receive<WG2983> the early<WG4406> and<WG2532> latter<WG3797> rain.<WG5205>
Be ye also patient;<WG3114> <WG5210> <WG2532> establish<WG4741> your<WG5216> hearts:<WG2588> for<WG3754> the<WG3588> coming<WG3952> of the<WG3588> Lord<WG2962> draweth nigh.<WG1448>

Grudge <WG4727> not<WG3361> one against another,<WG240> <WG2596> brethren,<WG80> lest<WG3363> ye be condemned:<WG2632> behold,<WG2400> the<WG3588> judge<WG2923> standeth<WG2476> before<WG4253> the<WG3588> door.<WG2374>

Take, <WG2983> my<WG3450> brethren,<WG80> the<WG3588> prophets,<WG4396> who<WG3739> have spoken<WG2980> in the<WG3588> name<WG3686> of the Lord,<WG2962> for an example<WG5262> of suffering affliction,<WG2552> and<WG2532> of patience.<WG3115>

Behold, <WG2400> we count them happy<WG3106> which endure.<WG5278> Ye have heard<WG191> of the<WG3588> patience<WG5281> of Job,<WG2492> and<WG2532> have seen<WG1492> the<WG3588> end<WG5056> of the Lord;<WG2962> that<WG3754> the<WG3588> Lord<WG2962> is<WG2076> very pitiful,<WG4184> and<WG2532> of tender mercy.<WG3629>

But <WG1161> above<WG4253> all things,<WG3956> my<WG3450> brethren,<WG80> swear<WG3660> not,<WG3361> neither<WG3383> by heaven,<WG3772> neither<WG3383> by the<WG3588> earth,<WG1093> neither<WG3383> by any<WG243> other<WG5100> oath:<WG3727> but<WG1161> let your<WG5216> yea<WG3483> be<WG2277> yea;<WG3483> and<WG2532> your<WG3588> nay,<WG3756> nay;<WG3756> lest<WG3363> ye fall<WG4098> into<WG1519> condemnation.<WG5272>
Is any among you afflicted?<WG2553> <WG5100> <WG1722> <WG5213> let him pray.<WG4336> Is any merry?<WG2114> <WG5100> let him sing psalms.<WG5567>

Is any sick<WG770> <WG5100> among<WG1722> you?<WG5213> let him call for<WG4341> the<WG3588> elders<WG4245> of the<WG3588> church;<WG1577> and<WG2532> let them pray<WG4336> over<WG1909> him,<WG846> anointing<WG218> him<WG846> with oil<WG1637> in<WG1722> the<WG3588> name<WG3686> of the<WG3588> Lord: <WG2962>

And <WG2532> the<WG3588> prayer<WG2171> of faith<WG4102> shall save<WG4982> the<WG3588> sick,<WG2577> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> Lord<WG2962> shall raise him up;<WG1453> <WG846> and if<WG2579> he have<WG5600> committed<WG4160> sins,<WG266> they shall be forgiven<WG863> him.<WG846>

Confess <WG1843> your faults<WG3900> one to another,<WG240> and<WG2532> pray<WG2172> one for another,<WG240> <WG5228> that<WG3704> ye may be healed.<WG2390> The effectual fervent<WG1754> prayer<WG1162> of a righteous man<WG1342> availeth<WG2480> much.<WG4183>

Elijah <WG2243> was<WG2258> a man<WG444> subject to like passions<WG3663> as we<WG2254> are, and<WG2532> he prayed earnestly<WG4336> <WG4335> that it might not<WG3361> rain:<WG1026> and<WG2532> it rained<WG1026> not<WG3756> on<WG1909> the<WG3588> earth<WG1093> by the space of three<WG5140> years<WG1763> and<WG2532> six<WG1803> months.<WG3376>
And <WG2532> he prayed<WG4336> again,<WG3825> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> heaven<WG3772> gave<WG1325> rain,<WG5205> and<WG2532> the<WG3588> earth<WG1093> brought forth<WG985> her<WG848> fruit.<WG2590>
Brethren, <WG80> if<WG1437> any<WG5100> of<WG1722> you<WG5213> do err<WG4105> from<WG575> the<WG3588> truth,<WG225> and<WG2532> one<WG5100> convert<WG1994> him;<WG846>

Let him know,<WG1097> that<WG3754> he which converteth<WG1994> the sinner<WG268> from<WG1537> the error<WG4106> of his<WG846> way<WG3598> shall save<WG4982> a soul<WG5590> from<WG1537> death,<WG2288> and<WG2532> shall hide<WG2572> a multitude<WG4128> of sins.<WG266>
